meanings.definition: A blank page inserted between the pages of a book.
meanings.sent1: The interleaf in the book was useful for jotting down notes.
meanings.sent2: The librarian placed an interleaf between the chapters to separate them.
meanings.sent3: The interleaf felt like a secret hiding spot in the middle of the book.
meanings.sent4: The interleaf acted as a peaceful pause in the midst of the story's chaos.
meanings.sent5: The interleaf fluttered as the reader turned the pages, waiting to be filled with thoughts.

meanings.definition: To insert blank pages between the pages of a book.
meanings.sent1: She would interleaf the novel with colorful pages to make it unique.
meanings.sent2: The author decided to interleaf the manuscript for better organization.
meanings.sent3: He would interleaf the book with surprise drawings to delight the readers.
meanings.sent4: The editor suggested to interleaf the text with quotes for added depth.
meanings.sent5: The designer planned to interleaf the pages with delicate patterns for visual appeal.
